item.title: [ 40] Ace Attorney
item.description:
...Investigations Collection? Peak. And all because of the second game.

>At least 3 of the case villains are up there with the best of them, only T&T had this many.
>Not a single below average case, at least two S tier cases and the rest are A tier, maybe one B.
>All the cases are perfectly integrated, literally no filler, every character (except Larry) matters.
>The villain reveal is the greatest plot twist in the entire series and subtler than 3DS game forced drama villain reveals.
>The main villain is arguably the hero of the story, who objectively saved more lives than he killed and in a just criminal system, shouldn't remain in prison too long.

And you actually get your money's worth with the remake, not only is the translation relatively censorship free, the visual upgrades to the sprites make the original version obsolete (you can still play with them if you want, I only chose to play with the original soundtrack). I had to wait 13 years (and four months) to play the game translated after I originally played the Japanese version (back then there was no hope for an English release ever and the fan translation was still years away as well). I patiently waited and skipped the fan translation entirely and the wait for the remake was worth it.

Original filename: ace attorney edgeworth waits for AAI2 in English.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 36] White House considers suspending habeas corpus
item.description:
https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c0qgz18glljo

Donald Trump's administration is "actively looking at" suspending habeas corpus - the right of a person to challenge their detention in court - one of the US president's top aides has said.

Stephen Miller, the White House deputy chief of staff, told reporters on Friday that the US Constitution allowed for the legal liberty to be suspended in times of "rebellion or invasion".

His comments come as judges have sought to challenge some recent detentions made by the Trump administration in an effort to combat illegal immigration, as well as remove dissenting foreign students.

"A lot of it depends on whether the courts do the right thing or not," Miller said.

There are several pending civil cases against the Trump administration's deportation of undocumented migrants based on habeaus corpus.

Most recently, a federal judge ordered the release of a Turkish university student who had been detained for six weeks after writing an article that was critical of Israel.

Last week, another judge ordered a Columbia University student detained over his advocacy for Palestinians be released after a petition on habeas corpus grounds.

However, other judges have sided with the Trump administration in such disputes.

Miller described habeas corpus as a "privilege", and said Congress had already passed a law stripping judicial courts of jurisdiction over immigration cases.

Legal experts and critics have questioned the veracity of his interpretation of US law.

"Congress has the authority to suspend habeas corpus - not Stephen Miller, not the president," Marc Elias, an attorney for the Democratic Party, told MSNBC.

item.title: [265] /co/ General Drawthread
item.description:
>Provide References for all requested characters and keep them to one image/post
>Keep requests /co/ related and keep them concise.
>General OC discussion belongs in "Work on your art" and the Donut Steel threads.
>However, OC requests are allowed as long as they aren't /trash/ material or fanfiction. If it's not /coc/ you must provide a link to the comic or cartoon.
>Be patient and take it easy! Don't forget to check the booru to see if your request was filled.
>Drawfriends, don't hold back.
>If a post breaks the rules, DO report and hide it. DON'T respond to it.
>Keep art critique short, otherwise take it to the Batman thread.
>No one is entitled to a request delivery.
>Don't bump or "second", "third", etc. requests. They eat up the post limit.
>No spam.
>Don't fight spam with spam.
>No begging.
>No AI deliveries, no AI discussion. Take them where they're wanted.
>To make the new Drawthread, wait for page 10 at bump limit.
>Have fun!

>Collection of Deliveries:
https://co.llection.pics/

>Drawfriends Gallery List:
rentry.org/txf8t

NSFW deliveries and requests should be posted in:
>>>/aco/drawthread
or
>>>/i/795305

Previous thread: >>148514425
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [151] AI Pokemon Thread /NAPT/ Thread 184: Enchanting Bellelba Edition
item.description:
This is a general thread for people to post their AI art, and make requests from others who may want to attempt making their own Pokemon related gens.

NovelAI is a paid AI generator. Opus tier users have "unlimited" Small/Normal generations, though editing tools require credits.

Microsoft's Bing AI is a free image generator that is powered by DALL·E 3.

Civitai is free using its ‘buzz’ currency. You get about 50 every day plus more for liking models and gens.
>civitai.com

Otaiku is a (mostly) free mobile app. An ad watch is required between each image generation unless you pay.
>ailla.biz/otaiku

Tensor is free to use as well, although you are limited to how many gens you can make per day.
>https://tensor.art/

Local Generation using Stable Diffusion requires a decent video card. Guides for local genning can be found in the /g/ threads:
>>>/g/sdg
>>>/g/ldg
Other Stable Diffusion threads are on: /h/, /e/, /d/, /b/, /vt/, /aco/, /trash/

Hailuo AI takes uploaded art and animates them based on the prompts you get. You get a 3-day free trial, followed by roughly 3 free gens a day afterward. Subscription plans are available.
>https://hailuoai.video/

Pastebin of Pokemon artists:
>https://pastebin.com/U0mmK3Tm (embed)

Characters with under 300 images will require more tags to have them look correct. This is a list of all Pokemon characters with over 300 images:
>https://danbooru.donmai.us/posts?tags=*_%28pokemon%29+&z=5

If you plan on sharing multiple images together, we'd recommend posting just one, and give links for the rest. This way we can conserve space.

This is a locally run html tool provided by ThatOneAiAnon. It keeps track of all artists you like and turns Danbooru's entire tag system in a collapsible list of buttons. You can edit all the js, css, html code to modify the tool. (Ask him for updated versions or more Nai4 tools)
>mega .nz/file/67xwTRSB#m0fPUmJRaWd3oh47gt6nw2LKNMe820TaiKdXTAhx8tI

Previous Thread:>>57762891

item.title: [ 73] Luigi was right
item.description:
>The group, which is seeking unspecified damages, argued that the public backlash [to the shooting] prevented the company from pursuing "the aggressive, anti-consumer tactics that it would need to achieve" its earnings goals.

https://www.cnbc.com/2025/05/08/unitedhealthcare-sued-by-shareholders-over-reaction-to-ceos-killing.html

A group of investors sued UnitedHealthcare Group

on Wednesday, accusing the company of misleading them after the killing of its CEO, Brian Thompson.

The class action lawsuit — filed in the Southern District of New York — accuses the health insurance company of not initially adjusting their 2025 net earning outlook to factor in how Thompson's killing would affect their operations.

On Dec. 3 — a day before Thompson was fatally shot — the company issued guidance that included net earnings of $28.15 to $28.65 per share and adjusted net earnings of $29.50 to $30.00 per share, the suit notes. And on January 16, the company announced that it was sticking with its old forecast.

The investors described this as "materially false and misleading," pointing to the immense public scrutiny the company and the broader health insurance industry experienced in the wake of Thompson's killing.

The group, which is seeking unspecified damages, argued that the public backlash prevented the company from pursuing "the aggressive, anti-consumer tactics that it would need to achieve" its earnings goals.

"As such, the Company was deliberately reckless in doubling down on its previously issued guidance," the suit reads.

item.title: [190] /cfb/ - Not so fast! edition
item.description:
>Michigan Coach Suspension
Sherrone Moore faces a reported two-game suspension due to the Connor Stalions scandal, missing games against Central Michigan and Nebraska but allowed to coach against Oklahoma.

>Lee Corso’s Retirement
Longtime ESPN College GameDay analyst Lee Corso will retire after Week 1 of the 2025 season, marking the end of an era.

>NCAA Governance Changes Proposed
NCAA President Charlie Baker announced plans for a new governance structure to be released in July, granting individual sports more control over their rules and policies. This aims to give Power 4 conferences greater influence.

>House v. NCAA Settlement Update
A new brief in the House v. NCAA case includes provisions to grandfather in athletes affected by roster cuts for the 2025-26 season, allowing reinstatement at schools' discretion.

>Nico Iamaleava Transfer Drama
Former Tennessee QB Nico Iamaleava’s transfer to UCLA continues to make waves, with Arkansas’ NIL collective seeking a $200K buyout from him and another player.

>Clemson’s Unique Addition
Ian Schieffelin, a basketball player, accepted coach Dabo Swinney’s offer to join Clemson’s football team, forgoing pro basketball for now.

>Transfer Portal Highlights
The spring transfer window closed, but top uncommitted prospects remain, with teams like UNLV and Tulane boosting rosters for playoff hopes.

>Recruiting News
The Class of 2026 five-star recruits are shaping up, with May expected to bring significant commitments.

Original filename: Sherrone Moore.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [159] /tpg/ /rcg/ - Theme Park & Roller Coaster General
item.description:
Disneyland Abu Dhabi Edition

>Last Thread: >>2779327

>What is this thread? Why are there two companies?
Disney parks were initially founded as a way to celebrate the culture and history of America and provide middle class families with a fun-filled immersive experience. While theme parks are the main focus of these threads (and the title of the general) there is also discussion on other roller coasters & rides, as well as the parks themselves and trip planning too. That's where /rcg/ comes in.
>Can I talk about Disney/Universal parks in this thread?
Absolutely! Disney and Universal are currently competing for the Orlando theme park market and beyond! Universal is opening new resorts all around the US and new continents!

Thread Pro Tip: Talk about theme parks!

Park Crowd Tracker:
>https://queue-times.com/en-US/parks

Roller Coaster Database:
>https://rcdb.com/

Amusement Park News Sites:
>https://www.themeparkinsider.com/
>https://www.screamscape.com/
>https://www.coaster101.com/

Disney Park News:
>https://www.wdwnt.com/
>https://www.wdwmagic.com/
>https://www.allears.net
>https://www.mousesteps.com

>News
Disneyland Abu Dhabi announced as Disney's 7th resort and first in Middle East. Miral Group (United Arab Emirates government) will entirely fund and operate the park
https://disneyparksblog.com/disney-experiences/disney-announces-abu-dhabi-theme-park/
Epic Universe officially opens in two weeks, but previews are showing heavy operational issues
https://wdwnt.com/2025/05/breaking-harry-potter-and-the-battle-at-the-ministry-to-temporarily-close-during-final-week-of-epic-universe-previews/
And your local theme parks are probably open for weekends now

item.title: [145] Fangame of Dubious Quality Submission Thread
item.description:
Developing a Pokémon fangame built almost entirely from submissions, replacing the original types, Pokémon, abilities, and moves.
Finally free from the irl obligation I mentioned last thread, and go most thing implemented as well

Main Doc: https://scrawny-crustacean-f0d.notion.site/Fangame-of-Dubious-Quality-1b5b9ecf5b6e80d5889dda00b4bf40e7

Typechart: https://files.catbox.moe/fxd84y.png


Currently open for submissions for:
- Type chart effectiveness changes
- Moves
- Abilities
- Items
- Sprites/Backsprites (See docs)
- Menu Sprites (128x64)
- Pokémon
- Important Earlygame Trainers

If you're interested in contributing but don't have any original ideas, you can also fill in requests, listed here:
https://scrawny-crustacean-f0d.notion.site/1c9b9ecf5b6e8089894ae49d5ef6dc23?v=1c9b9ecf5b6e8077b452000cede46188

Most of the submission options don't have a template since they're rather simple so don't need one, only Pokémon submissions:

>Name*:
>Type(s)*:
>Stats*:
>Gender Ratio:
>(Level Up) Move(s)*:
>Abilitiy/ies*:
>Growth Rate*:
>BaseXP:
>EVs:
>Catch Rate:
>Base Happiness:
>Height:
>Weight:
>Egg Group(s):
>Hatch Steps:
>Category+Pokedex*:
>Front Sprite*:
>Backsprite:
>Shiny:
>Wild held Item(s):
>Cry:
>Evolves To/Method:
>Evolves from:
*Required
Send links to sprites

Sprite Templates:
>Party Sprite: https://files.catbox.moe/31ex2n.png
>Item Sprite (Size): https://files.catbox.moe/nt7cap.png
>Ball Throw Sprite: https://files.catbox.moe/zi8eyc.png
>Ball Open Sprite: https://files.catbox.moe/3cei6k.png

item.title: [105] Cake and dessert thread
item.description:
Thread for desserts you've made, discussion and questions. Feel free to post and rate.

Starting with a cake I made and am currently eating.

Base is biscuits with cinnamon. There is a thin layer of cherry jam on on top of the base.
The main body is mascarpone mousse, with strawberry and quark.
Top layer is vanilla and white chocolate. The red pattern is the same stuff, with a bit of coloring.
On top I have some strawberries and basil. The strawberries were not really good. They are imported at this time of year where I live, so they are mainly for show, not for flavor.
Basil is my home grown and really goes well with strawberry.

Original filename: 100_0684.jpg

item.title: [ 37] Hey voyagers, The sticky probably needs to be updated, I'll keep the thread
item.description:
Hey voyagers,

The sticky probably needs to be updated, I'll keep the thread open for suggestions:

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

/trv/ is a slow board, so don't expect immediate responses. CHECK THE CATALOG – you might find threads already discussing topics you're interested in.

Before asking for suggestions, tell /trv/ about your:
>Budget
>Interests
>Level of understanding of the local language(s)
This makes it easier to give quality advice. Of course, keep your posts travel related.

For all other matters:
General culture questions >>>/int/
Politics discussion >>>/pol/
Transportation discussion >>>/n/
Outdoors-related discussion >>>/out/

For more information about safety, planning and other miscellaneous topics, check out the pastebin:

GENERAL INFO:
https://pastebin.com/yR1SAr3s

Note: Discussions of prostitution or sex tourism are not permitted on /trv/.
